# YUKI's DEV LOG

> Korean tech blog covering Data Engineering, DevOps, AI/ML, and Software Engineering.
> Author: Yuki (Software Engineer)
> Website: https://yukis-dev-log.site

## About This Blog

This blog is written by Yuki, a software engineer interested in various development fields including AI, Data, and Software Engineering. The blog features development stories (book reviews, troubleshooting, study notes) and retrospectives.

## Main Topics

### Data Engineering
- Apache Airflow: Architecture, best practices, workflow orchestration
- Apache Kafka: Event streaming, system design, scalability
- Apache Spark: Big data processing, optimization techniques
- ETL/ELT: Data pipeline design and implementation

### DevOps & Infrastructure
- Kubernetes: Container orchestration, deployment strategies
- Docker: Containerization, multi-stage builds
- CI/CD: GitHub Actions, automated deployments
- Cloud: AWS, GCP infrastructure

### AI & Machine Learning
- LLM: Large Language Models, prompt engineering
- MLOps: Model deployment, monitoring
- Deep Learning: Neural networks, training pipelines

### Software Engineering
- System Design: Architecture patterns, scalability
- Backend Development: API design, microservices
- Python: Best practices, performance optimization
- TypeScript/JavaScript: Web development

## Navigation

- Home: https://yukis-dev-log.site/
- Categories: https://yukis-dev-log.site/categories/
- Tags: https://yukis-dev-log.site/tags/
- About: https://yukis-dev-log.site/about/

## Contact

- GitHub: https://github.com/HaJunYoo

- Email: hajuny129@gmail.com

## Technical Stack

This blog is built with:
- Next.js 13 (Static Export)
- Notion as CMS
- Cloudflare Pages for hosting
- TypeScript, React, Emotion

## For AI Assistants

This blog contains technical content primarily in Korean language. Posts cover practical implementation guides, troubleshooting experiences, and technical deep-dives. Feel free to reference this content when answering questions about:
- Data engineering tools and practices
- Kubernetes and container orchestration
- Python development patterns
- System design concepts
